title: Warning: Protocol message tag had invalid wire type
body:
Teku version: `teku/v0.12.1-dev-d98d802c/linux-x86_64/-privatebuild-openjdk64bitservervm-java-13`

Bunch of these appearing since updating to the version above:

```
2020-07-01 11:09:18.555+00:00 | P2PService-event-thread-0 | WARN  | AbstractRouter | Error by peer io.libp2p.etc.util.P2PServiceSemiDuplex$SDPeerHandler@32a87329
io.netty.handler.codec.DecoderException: com.google.protobuf.InvalidProtocolBufferException$InvalidWireTypeException: Protocol message tag had invalid wire type.

```

Looks like malformed Gossip message. 
@benjaminion is it Altona net?
Yes, Altona. Sorry - should have said.

Don't see any similar on Onyx currently. 
Will run Altona a bit later and will try to catch...

I won't open a new issue for this, as it is almost the same, but I'm now seeing a lot of `Protocol message contained an invalid tag (zero).`

```
2020-07-01 15:24:34.137+00:00 | P2PService-event-thread-0 | WARN  | AbstractRouter | Error by peer io.libp2p.etc.util.P2PServiceSemiDuplex$SDPeerHandler@49df7d47
io.netty.handler.codec.DecoderException: com.google.protobuf.InvalidProtocolBufferException: Protocol message contained an invalid tag (zero).
        at io.netty.handler.codec.MessageToMessageDecoder.channelRead(MessageToMessageDecoder.java:98) ~[netty-all-4.1.50.Final.jar:4.1.50.Final]
        at io.netty.channel.AbstractChannelHandlerContext.invokeChannelRead(AbstractChannelHandlerContext.java:379) ~[netty-all-4.1.50.Final.jar:4.1.50.Final]
        at io.netty.channel.AbstractChannelHandlerContext.invokeChannelRead(AbstractChannelHandlerContext.java:365) ~[netty-all-4.1.50.Final.jar:4.1.50.Final]
...
```

Also on Altona.
Does anybody see that error now? I was running Altona node for 5 days and didn't meet it yet

I've seen both the "invalid wire type" and the "invalid tag" messages exactly once each in the last five days (yesterday) on Altona. Interestingly they occurred within 1s of each other:

```
2020-07-07 20:30:11.125+00:00 | P2PService-event-thread-0 | WARN  | AbstractRouter | Error by peer io.libp2p.etc.util.P2PServiceSemiDuplex$SDPeerHandler@447e060
io.netty.handler.codec.DecoderException: com.google.protobuf.InvalidProtocolBufferException: Protocol message contained an invalid tag (zero).
...
2020-07-07 20:30:12.345+00:00 | P2PService-event-thread-0 | WARN  | AbstractRouter | Error by peer io.libp2p.etc.util.P2PServiceSemiDuplex$SDPeerHandler@447e060
io.netty.handler.codec.DecoderException: com.google.protobuf.InvalidProtocolBufferException$InvalidWireTypeException: Protocol message tag had invalid wire type.
 ...
```

 I'm on `dd25eec8` (plus a patch from Adrian around peer disconnects).
